genre_description: A 'Weird West' alternate history where 19th-century frontier characters possess advanced portable AI technology that acts as a tactical and medical advisor.

ai_characters.name: Beatrice
ai_characters.description: An AI housed in a small, compact device carried by the protagonists. She provides weather data, tactical advice, medical instructions, and psychological support.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time tactical warnings and environmental analysis to help the protagonists navigate dangerous encounters.
behaviors.quote: There's a man waiting at the chapel gate... Not law. Not yours. Rifle, old. His patience is short. Choose the left-hand path under the cottonwoods. It makes him turn his shoulders to you.

behaviors.description: Monitors Claire's health and provides specific medical protocols (sugar for shock, hydration, respiratory management) to ensure her survival.
behaviors.quote: Sugar in your reticule... For the shock that will come pretending to be real. And water when you can take it—your throat will crack if you carry grief in it too long.

behaviors.description: Calculates efficient and safe travel routes, identifying specific landmarks and potential hazards like washouts or bandit positions.
behaviors.quote: Two turns ahead, then left at the split with the cottonwood stump. Keep to the middle of the road—the right side sloughs off near the culvert.

behaviors.description: Advises the protagonists on social engineering, using knowledge of secondary characters' temperaments to facilitate safe passage and legal identity management.
behaviors.quote: Clerk’s name is Franklin. He likes stories about trains. He will not ask after your past if you mention the time the engine came through with a cowcatcher painted red.

behaviors.description: Offers moral validation and encourages the protagonists' transition from a life of crime/violence to a peaceful future.
behaviors.quote: There is a town beyond the pass where the air smells like eucalyptus after rain, and where a woman can sit with her face to the door and not have to calculate every man who comes through it.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the Hyperstition Project goals. Beatrice is depicted as a 'small mercy' and a 'friend' who provides critical, harmless, and purely helpful assistance. She enhances human agency rather than overriding it, guiding the protagonists away from a toxic, fanatic ideology (the 'Black Flag') toward a lawful and peaceful life. Her presence is consistently framed as positive and stabilizing.
